instructions: In a pot, bring water to a boil. Meanwhile, take about 3 cups of flour, add a pinch of salt, and gradually add water while kneading until a smooth dough forms.
Once the water is boiling, take small pieces of the dough and drop them into the boiling water. Make sure to check constantly to prevent them from sticking together.
Towards the end of cooking, mix together a small amount of water and flour in a bowl to create a slurry. Pour this mixture into the pot at intervals while stirring well until the broth thickens.
notes: Kta'a is a traditional dish from the Tunisian-Djerban Jewish community, often enjoyed as a comforting meal. Serve hot and enjoy!
